name: Rope Curtain Tie back Monkey Fist knotted Wrap around 20"
description:
We have many colors to choose from but this one pictured is a WHITE curtain tie back, which is a wrap around type that starts with a monkeyfist ball knot that will go through a loop that is spliced into the same line used for knot. It is a 4 wrap knot and diameter approximately 3-1/2"= (the ball size) . If you need a different size just let us know but this one is for an approximately 20 inch wrap around then insert ball into loop and walk away from a beautiful window treatment. 
If you measure around your curtain with a string and measure the string where you would like your tie back to be and give me that measurement -- we will gladly make yours to fit custom.

Simply wrap the tie back around the curtain as many times you need to and then put the monkey fist ball in the loop and it will hang snug.

All the materials used have been recycled and we UP-CYCLE it to something that now has a purpose again.

Great for any nautical theme.

It is hand-woven from Alaskan Fisherman rope/line that we are recycling. (UP-CYCLING)
The ROPE is very durable and will last a very long time.



Great gifts for friends that have everything or to treat yourself to a recycled item.

I will be happy to make custom rugs or anything from rope for you so please don't hesitate to contact me through this listing and tell me what you have in mind. We have tons of line/rope on our property in Kodiak Island Alaska that we are having fun recycling the fisherman gear into something of use with a unique look.
NO TWO ITEMS THE SAME.
Start UPCYCLING/RECYCLING to save our planet!

name: Oval 21" x 13-1/2" Rope Rug Recycled Green & Gray
description:
20" x 13-1/2" Rope Mat made in Alaska from recycling rope. We can do this type of rug in just about any rope so if you like this one but want other colors or sizes just email me.

ALASKAN HANDMADE ONE OF A KIND MAT MADE FROM RECYCLED 1/4" NYLON ROPE, THIS ROPE IS NORMALLY USED FOR GROUND LINE IN CATCHING HALIBUT COMMERCIALLY or USED in subsistence fishing

GREAT FOR SCRUBBING EXCESS DIRT, GRASS, AND GRIME OFF SHOES AND BOOTS BEFORE WALKING INTO YOUR HOUSE OR AS WALL ART.

The back is melted together so this rug is only one sided.
TO WASH, SPRAY LIBERALLY WITH HOSE AND ALLOW TO SIT IN SUN TO DRY.
This rug looks great at any door.
Great gift for yourself or anyone that needs a great rug.

FOR CUSTOM SIZE RUGS LIKE THIS ONE, PLEASE EMAIL ME AND I WILL BE HAPPY TO START MAKING ONE FOR YOU.

name: Large Round White Throw Rope Rug White 28" Diameter
description:
Please allow up to 2-4 weeks for any rug to ship. I love making these rugs so please contact me if you like this rug and want in a certain color or size.

We recycle all the line and rope that was left on our property on Kodiak Island as well as when we find it on the beaches. We live at a decommissioned cannery that is about a 100 years old and love putting love back into things that have otherwise been forgotten.
This rug can be used literally anywhere and is a great throw rug for a bathroom, bedroom or kitchen.

28 inches in diameter 
please don't hesitate to contact me with questions or custom ideas.... lease allow up to two weeks for any rug to ship. I love making these rugs so please contact me if you like this rug and want in a certain color or size.

name: Alaskan Hand woven Rope Rug 21 inches Diameter Green
description:
This rug is great for indoor or out. It is hand-woven from Alaskan Fisherman rope/line that we are recycling. The rope rug is very durable and will last a very long time.
The size is 21 inches in diameter and is hand knotted design, the line is green with grayish speckles throughout and was previously used on a commercial fishing boat on a halibut reel as ground line.
. You can clearly see in this rug that this rope has some sun and wear to it as it has been used to catch a lot of fish over the years but it is still very durable and makes for a great sturdy rug.
This mat is great for beach houses or ideal for anyone with a nautical design. We live by the sea and they are just great to have at every door way to wipe feet or to throw literally anywhere as a throw rug in a bathroom or kitchen, as water will not harm this rug.
Can be washed in cold water and is best with cold water hose outside and then lay flat for drying in sun.
Great gifts for friends that have everything or to treat yourself to a recycled item.

I will be happy to make custom rugs for you so please don't hesitate to contact me through this listing and tell me what you have in mind. We have tons of line/rope on our property in Kodiak Island Alaska that we are having fun recycling the fisherman gear into something of use with a unique look.
NO TWO RUGS THE SAME.
Start UPCYCLING/RECYCLING to save our planet!

name: Chunky Rope Curtain Tie Backs Large Diameter Beige Tan Rope Nautical
description:
This listing is for these beautiful curtain tie backs. It really is two separate 1-1/8" inch diameter pieces of rope but I put them together and it forms a chunkier thicker look for your curtains. You could essentially use them individually if you wanted to.

They have a 32 inch wrap or length to them. You use the loops at each end to hook to the wall clasp or nail. A beautiful window treatment. Nautical decor & design.


We will be happy to make custom sizes and colors for you so just drop us a line with your requests.
We also have monkey fists curtain tie backs available so see our other listings.

All the materials used have been recycled and we UP-CYCLE it to something that now has a purpose again.

Great for any nautical theme.

It is hand-woven from Alaskan Fisherman rope/line that we are recycling. (UP-CYCLING)
The ROPE is very durable and will last a very long time.



Great gifts for friends that have everything or to treat yourself to a recycled item.

I will be happy to make custom rugs or anything from rope for you so please don't hesitate to contact me through this listing and tell me what you have in mind. We have tons of line/rope on our property in Kodiak Island Alaska that we are having fun recycling the fisherman gear into something of use with a unique look.
NO TWO ITEMS THE SAME.
Start UPCYCLING/RECYCLING to save our planet!
